keyFactors.title: Target Share Decline
keyFactors.description: Allen averaged only 5 targets over previous 3 games with route share dipping to 50.7% as Chargers rotated receivers.

keyFactors.title: Offensive Distribution
keyFactors.description: Chargers balanced philosophy emphasized spreading the ball rather than force-feeding veteran receivers.

keyFactors.title: Matchup Misdirection
keyFactors.description: Despite Pittsburgh ranking last in pass defense, Steelers game plan prioritized limiting explosive plays to top receivers.

riskFactors: Pittsburgh poor pass defense could create opportunities
Allen veteran savvy in red zone

quarterBreakdown.description: Allen caught 1 reception for 9 yards in first half as Chargers built 17-7 lead. Limited targets in run-heavy approach.
Added 1 more reception for 10 yards. Cleared under at this point with 19 total yards.
Chargers run out clock with blowout lead. Allen finished with just 2 catches on 5 targets.

gameResults.gamePace: Chargers dominated 25-10, limiting pass volume overall. Lowest yardage game of season.

whatWentRight.title: Usage Trend Validated
whatWentRight.description: Allen declining target share continued exactly as projected. Only 5 targets despite blowout.

whatWentRight.title: Game Script Perfect
whatWentRight.description: 25-10 blowout allowed Chargers to control tempo and limit overall pass volume.

whatWentRight.title: Market Mispricing
whatWentRight.description: The -115 under offered value because market overweighted Pittsburgh poor pass defense.

statisticalContext.percentileRanking: Bottom 10% of season receiving yards performances

closingLineValue.verdict: Slight positive CLV - line held steady as public expected Allen to exploit poor defense

keyTakeaways: Target share trends trump defensive rankings
Offensive philosophy matters - Chargers balanced approach limited Allen role
Game script awareness - 25-10 blowout reduced pass volume
Market mispricing created value on the under
verdict: Textbook example of identifying value when market overweights opponent weakness without accounting for usage trends.
